ygData.subject: Distributed NEAT experiment in progress
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey, all! My distributed NEAT experiment is up and running!  I ve got 7 computers conscripted into participating (so far), and it seems to be working well. The

Subject: Distributed NEAT experiment in progress

Hey, all!

My distributed NEAT experiment is up and running!  I've got 7 computers 
conscripted into participating (so far), and it seems to be working well.  
The experiment status page sucks, but it's better than nothing.  Not MUCH 
better, but...

http://www.hanlonsrazor.com:81/neat/iex/status.html

Some of the things I hope to add to the page include:

1. more useful and/or interesting stats
2. SVG visualization of the current champion network
3. example enlargements performed by the current champion (once it actually 
gets somewhere near a solution)

If anyone is running Linux and is willing to donate idle CPU cycles, you can 
download the client from

http://www.hanlonsrazor.com:81/neat/iex/iex_client.pl

Before you run it, edit the $cpu variable to match your CPU (for compiling 
optimization purposes).  If you want to help, but don't know what to put in 
that variable, send me the output for /proc/cpuinfo.  If you decide to run 
multiple instances on the same machine (to make optimal use of available 
resources), make sure each is running in a separate directory so that it 
doesn't overwrite temporary files.  I'll clean that up and make it more user 
friendly later.

And if you do decide to donate CPU cycles...THANKS!

-- John
